thread.title: GOL (G3) The Brazilian Company Joins BSP In Australia
thread.title_full: GOL (G3) The Brazilian Company Joins BSP In Australia

author: Thidawan Tunya
title: GOL (G3) The Brazilian Company Joins BSP In Australia
text:
Email 
GOL, Linhas Aéreas Inteligentes S.A. is the largest low-cost airline in Latin America, offering around 900 daily flights to 73 destinations, 17 of which are international to South America, the Caribbean and the United States. GOL has a young, modern fleet of Boeing 737-700 and 737-800 Next Generation (NG) aircraft, the safest, most efficient and economical of their type with an average age of 7.5 years. GOL currently has interline agreements with 79 airlines. 
GOL was founded in 2001 to offer air travel in Brazil and throughout South America at competitive fares. Its strategy of seeking profitable growth through its low cost model with high quality customer service allows the Company to offer competitive fares. 
The Company carried 37.7 million passengers in 2014. In order to build this tradition of achievement and growth, the Company relies on approximately 16,354 employees. In addition to strong, profitable growth and expanding markets for air travel, another characteristic of GOL’s history has been the use of technology. The Company revolutionized the Brazilian civil aviation sector by concentrating its sales on the Internet and by introducing intelligent web-based check-in, as well as being the first Brazilian company to make the entire check-in procedure possible via mobile phone. 
The Company remains focused on developing and enhancing its products and services through investments in operations, systems and processes, as well as the launch of products such as GOL+ on all domestic Brazilian routes, offering increased comfort and a better flying experience. As a result, GOL has the largest number of A-seal seats (an ANAC classification standard). 
GOL has a very small percentage of delayed flights, at only 6%, thanks to the continuous improvements made in the check-in process. GOLs website also enables passengers an easier and faster ticket purchasing process. 
GOL’s shares are listed on the NYSE and the Bovespa. 
GOL announces that in Australia they will be represented by DISCOVER THE WORLD
